## levenshtein variable

Computes Levenshtein distance w/ optionally given `maxDist` (for early termination, default: âˆž) and equality predicate (default: `===`<!-- -->). Returns 0 if both `a` and `b` are equal (based on predicate). Returns `Infinity` if actual distance &gt; `maxDist`<!-- -->.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
levenshtein: <T>(a: ArrayLike<T>, b: ArrayLike<T>, maxDist?: number, equiv?: import("@thi.ng/api").Fn2<T, T, boolean>) => number
```

## Remarks

Based on: - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Levenshtein\_distance - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wagner%E2%80%93Fischer\_algorithm - https://github.com/gustf/js-levenshtein/blob/master/index.js

## Example


```ts
levenshtein([1, 2, 3, 4, 5], [1, 2, 4, 3, 5]);
// 2

levenshtein(
  [{ id: 1 }, { id: 2 }, { id: 3 }, { id: 4 }, { id: 5 }],
  [{ id: 4 }, { id: 5 }, { id: 3 }, { id: 1 }, { id: 2 }],
  // max dist
  2,
  // predicate
  (a, b) => a.id === b.id
)
// Infinity

```
